If someone posts a link to content considered PG-13+, obviously that can get snipped by mods, but I've seen cases where, when the person provides clear warning the content may not be suitable for all ages, it is left alone. Is there an official stance on this or is it pretty much just up to the discretion of the mod assessing it at the time?

The official stance is that non-PG content cannot be embedded or linked here, warning or no. If such content has been left alone it is likely that it was not brought to the attention of the moderation team. 

For the most part we follow the Principle of Minimum Moderation and try to be reactive rather than proactive (one of our best moderators says we are firefighters, not police). Unless something we see is particularly egregious or so clearly in violation of the rules that we can't leave it be then we usually wait for someone to complain about it. The last thing we want is to be seen as eager to moderate or exercise our powers, so generally we do so reluctantly and as lightly as possible.

I think that the language filter applies to all posts in the forums. Also, remember that Squad is an account that is run by moderators, and I don't think that they would want to have Squad getting away with something that a normal user couldn't.

Links to material that includes bad language is a grey area. We make decisions on a case-by-case basis. And several people have access to the Squad forum account. KasperVld posts many things on behalf of Squad, but I believe Squad members can also use it themselves. They almost never do, though, and go through Kasper instead. I don't think there's ever been an occasion where the moderators were opposed to something the Squad account wanted to post, but it is Squad's forum, so they'd have the final word. 

This is all hypothetical, though, as there has never been a conflict. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
What is your average response time to a reported post?

Depends on time of day and how many moderators are active, and how much discussion about the report is required before deciding how to proceed. For something simple like a necro or "please lock" report it might only be a few minutes. Something more complicated or requiring an admin to look at might take hours.
